item.title: Persuasion
item.description: Persuasion in context Since this was a re-read after [[books/jane austen the secret radical|Jane Austen, The Secret Radical]], Iâ€™m going to put my relevant highlights from that book here. The references to Burney in Northanger Abbey date to the late 1790s or very early nineteenth century, certainly no later than 1802 or 1803, because in 1802 Burney traveled to France to assist her French husband in some family business, taking advantage of the short-lived cessation of hostilities between France and Britain.
